speaker: Lucas
text: Thanks for joining the session, everyone. Let's start with the feature requested by the product team.
ipa: θæŋks fɔr ˈʤɔɪnɪŋ ðə ˈsɛʃən, ˈɛvrɪˌwʌn | lɛts stɑrt wɪð ðə ˈfiʧər rɪˈkwɛstɪd baɪ ðə ˈprɑdəkt tim
stress: THANKS for JOINING the SESSION, EVERYONE | Let's START with the FEATURE REQUESTED by the PRODUCT TEAM
linking:
"joining the" → /ˈʤɔɪnɪŋ ðə/ (g links to th)
"start with" → /stɑrt wɪð/ (t links to w)

speaker: Erin
text: Sure, I worked on the part of the service handling authentication. It's now much faster.
ipa: ʃʊr | aɪ wɜrkt ɑn ðə pɑrt əv ðə ˈsɜrvəs ˈhændlɪŋ ˌɔθənˈtɪkeɪʃən | ɪts naʊ mʌʧ ˈfæstər
stress: SURE | I WORKED on the PART of the SERVICE HANDLING AUTHENTICATION | It's NOW MUCH FASTER
linking:
"worked on" → /wɜrkt ɑn/ (d links to o)
"handling authentication" → /ˈhændlɪŋ ˌɔθənˈtɪkeɪʃən/ (g links to a)

speaker: Jin
text: I noticed a change affecting the login flow too. It seems smoother now.
ipa: aɪ ˈnoʊtɪst ə ʧeɪnʤ əˈfɛktɪŋ ðə ˈlɔgɪn floʊ tu | ɪt simz ˈsmuðər naʊ
stress: I NOTICED a CHANGE AFFECTING the LOGIN FLOW TOO | It SEEMS SMOOTHER NOW
linking:
"noticed a" → /ˈnoʊtɪst ə/ (d links to a)
"login flow" → /ˈlɔgɪn floʊ/ (n links to f)

speaker: Lucas
text: Nice. Erin, can you walk us through the logic used to verify tokens? We need to make sure it’s secure.
ipa: naɪs | ˈɛrɪn | kæn ju wɔk ʌs θru ðə ˈlɑʤɪk juzd tə ˈvɛrəˌfaɪ ˈtoʊkənz | wi nid tə meɪk ʃʊr ɪts sɪˈkjʊr
stress: NICE | ERIN, CAN you WALK us THROUGH the LOGIC USED to VERIFY TOKENS | We NEED to MAKE SURE it's SECURE
linking:
"walk us" → /wɔk ʌs/ (k links to u)
"verify tokens" → /ˈvɛrəˌfaɪ ˈtoʊkənz/ (y links to t)

speaker: Erin
text: Of course. I reused a method tested in our last security audit. It's reliable and fast.
ipa: əv kɔrs | aɪ riˈjuzd ə ˈmɛθəd ˈtɛstɪd ɪn aʊr læst sɪˈkjʊrəti ˈɔdɪt | ɪts rɪˈlaɪəbəl ənd fæst
stress: OF COURSE | I REUSED a METHOD TESTED in our LAST SECURITY AUDIT | It's RELIABLE and FAST
linking:
"reused a" → /riˈjuzd ə/ (d links to a)
"security audit" → /sɪˈkjʊrəti ˈɔdɪt/ (y links to a)

speaker: Jin
text: By the way, I added a banner informing users of session timeouts, just in case.
ipa: baɪ ðə weɪ | aɪ ˈædɪd ə ˈbænər ɪnˈfɔrmɪŋ ˈjuzərz əv ˈsɛʃən ˈtaɪmaʊts | ʤəst ɪn keɪs
stress: BY the WAY | I ADDED a BANNER INFORMING USERS of SESSION TIMEOUTS | JUST in CASE
linking:
"added a" → /ˈædɪd ə/ (d links to a)
"session timeouts" → /ˈsɛʃən ˈtaɪmaʊts/ (n links to t)

speaker: Lucas
text: Great. That’s a thoughtful addition improving user experience.
ipa: ɡreɪt | ðæts ə ˈθɔtfəl əˈdɪʃən ɪmˈpruvɪŋ ˈjuzər ɪkˈspɪriəns
stress: GREAT | THAT'S a THOUGHTFUL ADDITION IMPROVING USER EXPERIENCE

"improving user" → /ɪmˈpruvɪŋ ˈjuzər/ (g links to u)

speaker: Erin
text: Next, there's a bug reported during staging—it was due to a race condition.
ipa: nɛkst | ðɛrz ə bʌg rɪˈpɔrtɪd ˈdʊrɪŋ ˈsteɪʤɪŋ—it wəz du tə ə reɪs kənˈdɪʃən
stress: NEXT | THERE'S a BUG REPORTED DURING STAGING—it was DUE to a RACE CONDITION

"race condition" → /reɪs kənˈdɪʃən/ (e links to c)

speaker: Lucas
text: Right, I read a comment explaining the root cause. It made things much clearer.
ipa: raɪt | aɪ rɛd ə ˈkɑmɛnt ɪkˈspleɪnɪŋ ðə rut kɔz | ɪt meɪd θɪŋz mʌʧ ˈklɪrər
stress: RIGHT | I READ a COMMENT EXPLAINING the ROOT CAUSE | It MADE THINGS MUCH CLEARER

speaker: Jin
text: There’s also a suggestion to refactor the error handler. Should we add that to the backlog?
ipa: ðɛrz ˈɔlsoʊ ə səˈʤɛstʃən tə riˈfæktər ði ˈɛrər ˈhændlər | ʃʊd wi æd ðæt tə ðə ˈbæklɔg

speaker: Lucas
text: Yeah, add it. That’s an important fix to implement before the next release.
ipa: jæ | æd ɪt | ðæts ən ɪmˈpɔrtənt fɪks tə ˈɪmpləˌmɛnt bɪˈfɔr ðə nɛkst rɪˈlis
